title: Economic damage caused by floods in the U.S. 1995 to 2018
summary: This is a line chart with an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Damage in million U.S. dollars, containing a total of 20 data points.
Overall Damage in million U.S. dollars has increased over the Year.

The line significantly increased by 1886.0 from Year 2002 to 2003,increased by 2230.0 from Year 2005 to 2006,increased by 2128.0 from Year 2007 to 2008,increased by 2877.0 from Year 2009 to 2010,increased by 4051.0 from Year 2010 to 2011,decreased by 7484.0 from Year 2011 to 2012,increased by 1678.0 from Year 2012 to 2013,increased by 8158.0 from Year 2015 to 2016,increased by 49793.0 from Year 2016 to 2017, and lastly, decreased by 59056.0 from Year 2017 to 2018.
The most drastic decrease took place within the Year 2017 and 2018.
The highest Damage in million U.S. dollars, of value 60700.0 was reached at Year 2017
Minimum Damage in million U.S. dollars about 494.0 was reached at Year 2012
